text: Xia dynasty (Chinese: 夏朝; Pinyin: xià cháo; Wade–Giles: Hsia-ch'ao) was the first dynasty of China. It was founded in 2100 BC and ended in 1600 BC. Until archaeologists dug at Erlitou in Henan Province, many scientists were not sure if the Xia Dynasty was real or a myth. The last king was Jie who was said to be cruel and greedy. He was defeated by T'ang, the king of the Shang people from the east. == Kings of the Xia dynasty == Names after death (Shi Hao 諡號)1 Order Reign2 Chinese Pinyin Notes 01 45 禹 Yǔ also Yu the Great (大禹; dà yǔ) 02 10 啟 Qǐ 03 29 太康 Tai Kang 04 13 仲康 Zhòng Kāng 05 28 相 Xiāng 06 21 少康 Shǎo Kāng 07 17 杼 Zhù 08 26 槐 Huái 09 18 芒 Máng 10 16 泄 Xiè 11 59 不降 Bù Jiàng 12 21 扃 Jiōng 13 21 廑 Jǐn Guoyu: jìn, putonghua: jǐn 14 31 孔甲 Kǒng Jiǎ 15 11 皋 Gāo 16 11 發 Fā 17 52 桀 Jié also Lu Gui (履癸 lǚ guǐ) 1 Sometimes the king has the dynasty name, Xia (夏), in his name.
